skill.name: ui-design-system
skill.description: UI design system toolkit for Senior UI Designer including design token generation, component documentation, responsive design calculations, and developer handoff tools. Use for creating design systems, maintaining visual consistency, and facilitating design-dev collaboration.
skill.summary: UI design system toolkit for Senior UI Designer including design token generation, component documen...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure Python utility script with no file I/O, network access, or code execution vulnerabilities. Generates design tokens from command-line inputs and outputs to stdout. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.value_statement: Creating consistent design systems manually takes significant time and often results in inconsistent implementations. This toolkit automates design token generation for colors, typography, and spacing, ensuring visual harmony across all components and exports developer-ready code.
actual_capabilities: Generate complete color palettes from a single brand color
Create modular typography scales with font families
Build 8pt spacing grid systems for consistent layouts
Export tokens in JSON, CSS, and SCSS formats
Generate responsive breakpoints and z-index scales
Create shadow and animation tokens for motion design
limitations: Does not create actual component code or HTML
Does not validate existing design implementations
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma
Does not generate accessibility test reports

use_cases.title: Generate Developer Handoff
use_cases.description: Create ready-to-use design tokens that developers can copy directly into CSS or JavaScript projects.

use_cases.title: Build Design Systems
use_cases.description: Establish consistent token foundations for new design systems with automated color, type, and spacing values.

use_cases.title: Maintain Visual Consistency
use_cases.description: Generate reference documentation for design teams to ensure consistent application of design tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Color Palette
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the UI Design System skill to generate design tokens from the brand color #0066CC in modern style. Output the JSON format.

prompt_templates.title: Complete System
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete design token system using UI Design System with a custom brand color. Include all token types and export as CSS variables.

prompt_templates.title: Style Variant
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate the same design tokens in three different styles: modern, classic, and playful. Compare the typography and border radius differences.

prompt_templates.title: Developer Export
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate design tokens for my brand color and export them as SCSS variables I can use in a Sass project. Include spacing, colors, and typography.

output_examples.input: Generate design tokens from #3B82F6 with modern style
output: Color Palette: Primary (50-900), Secondary, Neutral, Semantic (success, warning, error, info)
Typography: Inter font family, 9 size steps from 12px to 48px, full weight and line-height scale
Spacing: 24 values from 0px to 448px with semantic names (xs, sm, md, lg, xl)
Breakpoints: xs: 480px, sm: 640px, md: 768px, lg: 1024px, xl: 1280px, 2xl: 1536px

best_practices: Start with a single primary brand color and let the system generate complementary palettes
Export to CSS variables for web projects or SCSS for Sass-based workflows
Use the modern style for tech products and classic for traditional applications
anti_patterns: Using generated tokens without reviewing contrast ratios for accessibility
Mixing tokens from different style presets in the same project
Applying all tokens without considering the specific use case context

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each platform can invoke the design token generator script.

faq.question: What formats can I export tokens in?
faq.answer: Supports JSON, CSS variables, and SCSS formats. JSON works for JavaScript projects, CSS for web, and SCSS for Sass.

faq.question: Can I integrate tokens with my existing codebase?
faq.answer: Yes. Copy the generated output into your project. CSS and SCSS can be imported directly. JSON works with most design system libraries.

faq.question: Is my design data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All generation happens locally in your session. No data is sent anywhere. Only command-line arguments are processed.

faq.question: Why are my colors different from the brand color?
faq.answer:: The system generates a full palette from 50-900 lightness values. Your brand color becomes the 500 base shade with lighter and darker variants.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual token creation?
faq.answer:: Automates calculations that would require color manipulation tools and spacing math. Ensures mathematical consistency across all token types.
